body: API wise we'd need to chmod it after creating it by listening. I'd suggest doing the same from the outside, but that's of course not 100% stable as Syncthing will recreate it if the listening config is changed etc.
@calmh  Hey can I work on this ?

@bjoe2k4 sorry for the late reply.
No, sadly I couldn't really figure it out

Never contributed before, but I also took a look and was stumped. Some questions about implementation that come to mind are:
- how is the option implemented (how to decide which files to apply to, how to decide which mode to use)
- would the permissions need to change in the FileInfo database or only where we actually modify the permissions
- when @calmh mention "listening", are you referring to event subscriptions
- I could not find where the default permissions for a file were set, so I don't even know why they are ~~0644~~ 0755 in the first place

issue.title: lib/config, gui: Set unix socket permissions for GUI listen address (fixes #5979)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
### Purpose

This pull request solves #5979.
The problem is that a user may wish a unix socket to have specific permissions.
We can solve this by adding a configuration option for unix socket permissions.

### Testing

Navigate under the web UI to Actions > Settings > GUI and change the GUI Listen Address line to a local file. That will be created as a web socket. Check the permissions of this file.

### Screenshots

![screen](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14015672/74387796-944b1280-4dc7-11ea-869f-b05721e8c96d.png)

### Documentation

https://github.com/syncthing/docs/pull/492

### Tasklist
- [X] Add basic implementation showcasing solution efficacy
- [x] Add configuration option
- [x] Add UI for configuration option
- [x] Use configuration option in code
- [x] Update man pages
- [X] Add documentation for new option
- [X] Finish PR information

based on the commit metadata.
-->
